str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and akouo; to mishear, i.e. to disobey.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
